Note: This attribute is valid when component type is set to weblogic only; it is not valid for otd or datagrid.

Maximum Permanent Generation (PermGen) space in Java heap memory (-XX:MaxPermSize) for a Managed Server JVM, specified in megabytes. The value must be greater than -1.

Not applicable for a WebLogic Server 12.2.1 instance, which uses JDK 8.

If you specify this maximum value, a value greater than 0 (zero) must also be specified for msInitialHeapMB, msMaxHeapMB, and msPermMB. In addition, msInitialHeapMB must be less than msMaxHeapMB, and msPermMB must be less than msMaxPermMB.

msPermMB.description:
Note: This attribute is valid when component type is set to weblogic only; it is not valid for otd or datagrid.

Initial Permanent Generation (PermGen) space in Java heap memory (-XX:PermSize) for a Managed Server JVM, specified in megabytes. The value must be greater than -1.

Not applicable for a WebLogic Server 12.2.1 instance which uses JDK 8.

If you specify this initial value, a value greater than 0 (zero) must also be specified for msInitialHeapMB, msMaxHeapMB, and msMaxPermMB. In addition, msInitialHeapMB must be less than msMaxHeapMB, and msPermMB must be less than msMaxPermMB.

mwVolumeSize.description:
Note: This attribute is valid when component type is set to weblogic only; it is not valid for otd or datagrid.

Size of the MW_HOME disk volume for the service (/u01/app/oracle/middleware). The value must be a multiple of GBs. You can specify this value in bytes or GBs. If specified in GBs, use the following format: nG, where n specifies the number of GBs. For example, you can express 10 GBs as bytes or GBs. For example: 100000000000 or 10G. This value defaults to the system configured volume size.

nodeManagerPort.description:
Note: This attribute is valid when component type is set to weblogic only; it is not valid for otd or datagrid.

Port for the Node Manager. The default value is 5556.

Node Manager is a WebLogic Server utility that enables you to start, shut down, and restart Administration Server and Managed Server instances from a remote location.

The adminPort, contentPort, securedAdminPort, securedContentPort, and nodeManagerPort values must be unique.

nodeManagerPassword.description:
Note: This attribute is valid when component type is set to weblogic only; it is not valid for otd or datagrid.

Password for Node Manager. This value defaults to the WebLogic administrator password.

nodeManagerUserName.description:
Note: This attribute is valid when component type is set to weblogic only; it is not valid for otd or datagrid.

User name for Node Manager. This value defaults to the WebLogic administrator user name.

overwriteMsJvmArgs.description:
Flag that determines whether the user defined Managed Server JVM arguments specified in msJvmArgs should replace the server start arguments (true), or append the server start arguments (false). Default is false.

The server start arguments are calculated automatically by Oracle Java Cloud Service from site default values.

If you append (that is, overwriteMsJvmArgs is false or is not set), the user defined arguments specified in msJvmArgs are added to the end of the server start arguments. If you overwrite (that is, set overwriteMsJvmArgs to true), the calculated server start arguments are replaced.

pdbServiceName.description:
Note: This attribute is valid when component type is set to weblogic only; it is not valid for otd or datagrid.

Name of the pluggable database for Oracle Database 12c. If not specified, the pluggable database name configured when the database was created will be used.

Note: This value does not apply to Oracle Database 11g.

privilegedContentPort.description:
Note: This attribute is valid when component type is set to weblogic only; it is not valid for otd or datagrid.

Privileged content port for accessing the deployed applications using HTTP. The default value is 80.

Note: This value has no effect if the load balancer is enabled.

To disable the privileged content port, set the value to 0. In this case, if the load balancer is not provisioned, the content port defaults to contentPort, if specified, or 8001.

privilegedListenerPort.description:
Note: This attribute is valid when component type is set to otd only; it is not valid for weblogic or datagrid.

Privileged listener port for accessing the deployed applications using HTTP. The default value is 80.

Note: This value has no effect if the load balancer is disabled.

To disable the privileged listener port, set the value to 0. In this case, if the load balancer is provisioned, the listener port defaults to listenerPort, if specified, or 8080.

privilegedSecuredContentPort.description:
Note: This attribute is valid when component type is set to weblogic only; it is not valid for otd or datagrid.

Privileged content port for accessing the deployed applications using HTTPS. The default value is 443.

Note: This value has no effect if the load balancer is enabled.

To disable the privileged listener port, set the value to 0. In this case, if the load balancer is not provisioned, this value defaults to securedContentPort, if specified, or 8002.

privilegedSecuredListenerPort.description:
Note: This attribute is valid when component type is set to otd only; it is not valid for weblogic or datagrid.

Privileged listener port for accessing the deployed applications using HTTPS. The default value is 443.

Note: This value has no effect if the load balancer is disabled.

To disable the privileged listener port, set the value to 0. In this case, if the load balancer is provisioned, the listener port defaults to securedListenerPort, if specified, or 8081.

scalingUnit.description:
Note: This attribute is valid when component type is set to datagrid only; it is not valid for weblogic or otd.

Required when using a custom capacity unit only. Groups attributes for a custom capacity unit.

On Oracle Public Cloud, see About Custom Capacity Units and Advanced Configuration for Oracle Java Cloud Service-Coherence Instances in Using Oracle Java Cloud Service for guidelines on defining properties for a custom capacity unit. On Oracle Cloud Machine, see About Custom Capacity Units and Advanced Configuration for Oracle Java Cloud Service-Coherence Instances in Using Oracle Java Cloud Service on OPCM.

heapSize.description:
Heap size to configure with each JVM, based on the memory available from the chosen compute shape. Use a number from 1 GB to 16 GB.

Note that the JVM heap size multiplied by the number of JVMs per VM must not exceed the available memory. Consider using 75% of the memory after reserving 1500 MB for the operating system to calculate the heap size per JVM.

The total amount of primary cache storage to allocate for Coherence is based on the general rule of splitting the JVM heap size into thirds: using 1/3 for primary cache storage, 1/3 for backup storage, and 1/3 for scratch space.

If a custom capacity unit is configured with a single VM, there might not be space to store a backup copy of the Coherence data, so the actual data available might be more than 1/3 of the JVM heap size.

jvmCount.description: Number of JVMs to start on each VM. Use a number from 1 to 8.

shape.description:
Desired compute shape. A shape defines the number of Oracle Compute Units (OCPUs) and amount of memory (RAM). Valid shapes include:
  • oc3: 1 OCPU, 7.5 GB memory
  • oc4: 2 OCPUs, 15 GB memory
  • oc5: 4 OCPUs, 30 GB memory
  • oc6: 8 OCPUs, 60 GB memory
  • oc7: 16 OCPUs, 120 GB memory
  • oc1m: 1 OCPU, 15 GB memory
  • oc2m: 2 OCPUs, 30 GB memory
  • oc3m: 4 OCPUs, 60 GB memory
  • oc4m: 8 OCPUs, 120 GB memory
  • oc5m: 16 OCPUs, 240 GB memory

On Oracle Public Cloud, see About Machine Images and Shapes in Using Oracle Compute Cloud Service (for PaaS).

vmCount.description:
Number of VMs to configure for a custom capacity unit.

Use a number from 1 to 3. Use 3 VMs to achieve Coherence high availability.

scalingUnitCount.description:
Note: This attribute is valid when component type is set to datagrid only; it is not valid for weblogic or otd.

The number of capacity units to add. This value cannot be 0 (zero).

Each capacity unit provides a fixed amount of primary cache storage to allocate for Coherence, based on the capacity unit's predefined properties for number of VMs, number of JVMs per VM, and heap size for each JVM.

scalingUnitName.description:
Note: This attribute is valid when component type is set to datagrid only; it is not valid for weblogic or otd.

Required when using a default capacity unit only. Valid names are:

  • BASIC
  • SMALL
  • MEDIUM
  • LARGE

Each default capacity unit is one or three VMs with a predefined compute shape (processing power and RAM), running one or more JVMs or Managed Coherence Servers per VM to provide a predefined primary cache capacity. The amount of primary cache storage to allocate for Coherence is based on the general rule of splitting the JVM heap size into thirds: using 1/3 for primary cache storage, 1/3 for backup storage, and 1/3 for scratch space.

On Oracle Public Cloud, see About Default Capacity Units for Oracle Java Cloud Service-Coherence Instances in Using Oracle Java Cloud Service for information to help you decide which default configuration to use. On Oracle Cloud Machine, see About Default Capacity Units for Oracle Java Cloud Service-Coherence Instances in Using Oracle Java Cloud Service on OPCM.

securedAdminPort.description:
Note: This attribute is valid when component type is set to weblogic only; it is not valid for otd or datagrid.

Port for accessing the Administration Server using HTTPS. The default value is 7002.

The adminPort, contentPort, securedAdminPort, securedContentPort, and nodeManagerPort values must be unique.

securedContentPort.description:
Note: This attribute is valid when component type is set to weblogic only; it is not valid for otd or datagrid.

Port for accessing the Administration Server using HTTPS. The default value is 8002.

This value is overridden by privilegedSecuredContentPort unless its value is set to 0. This value has no effect if the load balancer is enabled.

The adminPort, contentPort, securedAdminPort, securedContentPort, and nodeManagerPort values must be unique.

securedListenerPort.description:
Note: This attribute is valid when component type is set to otd only; it is not valid for weblogic or datagrid.

Secured listener port for accessing the deployed applications using HTTPS. The default value is 8081.

This value is overridden by privilegedSecuredContentPort unless its value is set to 0. This value has not effect if the load balanced is disabled.

shape.description:
Note: This attribute is valid when component type is set to weblogic or otd only; it is not valid for datagrid.

Desired compute shape. A shape defines the number of Oracle Compute Units (OCPUs) and amount of memory (RAM). Valid shapes include:

  • oc3: 1 OCPU, 7.5 GB memory
  • oc4: 2 OCPUs, 15 GB memory
  • oc5: 4 OCPUs, 30 GB memory
  • oc6: 8 OCPUs, 60 GB memory
  • oc7: 16 OCPUs, 120 GB memory
  • oc1m: 1 OCPU, 15 GB memory
  • oc2m: 2 OCPUs, 30 GB memory
  • oc3m: 4 OCPUs, 60 GB memory
  • oc4m: 8 OCPUs, 120 GB memory
  • oc5m: 16 OCPUs, 240 GB memory

On Oracle Public Cloud, see About Machine Images and Shapes in Using Oracle Compute Cloud Service (for PaaS) for information about shapes.

type.description:
Component type to which the set of parameters applies. Valid values include:
  • weblogic - Oracle WebLogic Server
  • datagrid - Oracle Coherence
  • otd - Oracle Traffic Director (load balancer)

upperStackProductName.description:
Note: This attribute is valid when component type is set to weblogic only; it is not valid for otd or datagrid.

This attribute is only available on Oracle Public Cloud. It is required only if you are provisioning an Oracle Java Cloud Service instance for an Oracle Fusion Middleware product.

The Oracle Fusion Middleware product installer to add to this Oracle Java Cloud Service instance. Valid values are:

  • ODI - Oracle Data Integrator
  • WCP - Oracle WebCenter Portal

To use upperStackProductName, you must specify 12.2.1 as the WebLogic Server software version, EE or SUITE as the edition, and PAAS as the service level.

After the service instance is provisioned, the specified Fusion Middleware product installer is available in /u01/zips/upperstack on the Administration Server virtual machine. To install the product over the provisioned domain, follow the instructions provided by the Oracle product's installation and configuration documentation.

version.description:
Note: This attribute is valid when component type is set to weblogic only; it is not valid for otd or datagrid.

Oracle WebLogic Server software version. Valid values are: 12.2.1, 12.1.3 and 10.3.6.

You cannot use 10.3.6 when creating an instance and configuring the Coherence data tier at the same time.

On Oracle Public Cloud: Only 12.2.1 is valid if you are using upperStackProductName to provision a service instance for an Oracle Fusion Middleware product.

VMsPublicKey.description:
Note: This attribute is valid when component type is set to weblogic or otd only; it is not valid for datagrid.

The public key for the secure shell (SSH). This key will be used for authentication when connecting to the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance using an SSH client. You generate an SSH public-private key pair using a standard SSH key generation tool. On Oracle Public Cloud, see Generating a Secure Shell (SSH) Public-Private Key Pair in Using Oracle Java Cloud Service. On Oracle Cloud Machine, see Generating a Secure Shell (SSH) Public-Private Key Pair in Using Oracle Java Cloud Service on OPCM.

If not specified for otd, this value defaults to the VMsPublicKey value provided for weblogic.

Specify only one of the public key attributes for weblogic and otd: VMsPublicKey or VMsPublicKeyName

VMsPublicKeyName.description:
Note: This attribute is valid when component type is set to weblogic or otd only; it is not valid for datagrid.

Name of the compute SSH key object referring to the public key. You generate an SSH public-private key pair using a standard SSH key generation tool.

If not specified for otd, this value defaults to the VMsPublicKeyName value provided for weblogic.

Specify only one of the public key attributes for weblogic and otd: VMsPublicKey or VMsPublicKeyName

appDBs.description:
Details of a Database Cloud Service database deployment that is used to host an application schema, if used. The application database deployment can be created using Oracle Database 11g Release 2, Oracle Database 12c Release 1, or Oracle Database 12c Release 2.

This attribute is only available on Oracle Public Cloud.

dbaName.description:
User name for the database administrator.

For service instances based on Oracle WebLogic Server 11g (10.3.6), this value must be set to a database user with DBA role. You can use the default user SYSTEM or a user that has been granted the DBA role.

For service instances based on Oracle WebLogic Server 12c (12.2.1 and 12.1.3), this value must be set to a database user with SYSDBA system privileges. You can use the default user SYS or a user that has been granted the SYSDBA privilege.

dbaPassword.description: Database administrator password that was specified when the database deployment on Database Cloud Service was created.

dbServiceName.description: Name of the database deployment on Database Cloud Service to use for an application schema. The specified database deployment must be running.

pdbServiceName.description:
Name of the pluggable database for Oracle Database 12c. If not specified, the pluggable database name configured when the database was created will be used.

Note: This value does not apply to Oracle Database 11g.

custompayload.description:
This is only available on Oracle Public Cloud.

Specifies the location of your AppToCloud artifacts in an Oracle Storage Cloud Service container. Also specifies the data sources, foreign JNDI providers, and other resources as configured in the on-premises domain and applications you want to migrate to Oracle Java Cloud Service. Look in your exported JSON file for the data source bindings, service bindings, and other resource bindings.

ds.description:
Groups information about one or more data sources as configured in the source domain.

Each data source must be mapped to a database deployment in Oracle Database Cloud Service.

datasource.description: Replace this with the actual dataSourceName name of a dataSourceBindings, as found in the exported JSON file. Specify one data source object for each dataSourceName found in the exported JSON file.

Replace this with the actual dataSourceName name of a dataSourceBindings as found in the exported JSON file. The data source types supported at this time are: Generic, Multi, and GridLink. The value is the Database Cloud Service database deployment.

Note: For GridLink and Multi data sources, use a Database Cloud Service database deployment that hosts an Oracle Real Application Clusters (Oracle RAC) database.

targetDataSourceType.description:
The value can be one of the following: Generic, Multi, and GridLink.

If the specified Database Cloud Service database deployment does not use Oracle RAC, the value must be Generic.

If the specified Database Cloud Service database deployment uses Oracle RAC and the specified edition (for WebLogic Server software) is EE, the value must be Multi.

If the specified Database Cloud Service database deployment uses Oracle RAC and the specified edition (for WebLogic Server software) is SUITE, the value can be GridLink or Multi.

username.description: User name for the database administrator.

jndi.description:
Groups information about one or more foreign Java Naming and Directory Interface (JNDI) providers as configured in the source domain.

Each foreign JNDI provider must be configured with the URL that WebLogic Server uses to contact the JNDI provider, or destination information for an existing Oracle Java Cloud Service instance.

foreignjndi.description: Replace this with the actual resourceRef name of a foreign JNDI provider binding in serviceBindings, as found in the exported JSON file. Specify one object for each foreign JNDI provider binding found in the exported JSON file.

bypassPrecheck.description: Flag that specifies whether to validate the connection to the provider during the import operation precheck. Default is false, which means validation is performed and the operation does not continue if the connection is invalid. Set to true if you want to skip the connection validation during the operation precheck.

destination.description:
Information about an existing Oracle Java Cloud Service instance. Provide either server or cluster details for the destination.

Note that either destination or provider must be specified for each foreign JNDI provider object.

jaasInstance.description: Name of the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance to associate with.

cluster.description: Name of cluster in the associated service instance. Either cluster or server must be supplied.

protocol.description: A valid protocol type: t3, t3s, iiop or iiops.

server.description: Name of server in the associated service instance. Either server or cluster must be supplied.

provider.description:
The foreign JNDI provider URL.

Note that either destination or provider must be specified for each foreign JNDI provider object.

password.description: Can include a password. Must be specified if username is specified.

username.description: Can include a user name. Must be specified if password is specified.

storage.description: Groups information about the Oracle Storage Cloud Service container that contains the AppToCloud artifacts generated by the Export tool.

a2cModelJsonLocation.description: Location of the the Model Metadata Override JSON file that was generated when you used the AppToCloud Export tool on the domain configuration you wish to import into a service instance.

cloudStoragePwd.description: Password for the Oracle Storage Cloud Service user who has access to the container.

cloudStorageUser.description: User name for the Oracle Storage Cloud Service user who has access to the container.

mailSession.description:
Groups information about one or more Java mail sessions as configured in the source domain.

Each mail session can have a default, send, and receive object. A send or receive object cannot be added if the source domain does not have a transport (send) or store (receive) property.

javamailsession.description: Replace this with the actual resourceRef name of a mail session binding in serviceBindings, as found in the exported JSON file. Specify one object for each mail session binding found in the exported JSON file.

bypassPrecheck.description: Flag that specifies whether to validate a connection during the import operation precheck. Default is false, which means validation is performed and the operation does not continue if the connection is invalid. Set to true if you want to skip the connection validation during the operation precheck.

mailSessionName.description: This is the resourceRef name of a mail session binding as found in the exported JSON file.

defaultMail.description: Default property values for the mail host.

host.description: Name of the mail host machine. Must be specified if the send or receive host is not specified.

password.description: Can include a password. Must be specified if username is specified.

port.description: Port number on the default mail host to use if a protocol-specific mail port is not specified for the send host, receive host, or both.

username.description: Can include a user name. Must be specified if password is specified.

send.description: Property values for the send mail host.

host.description: Name of the send mail host machine. If this is not specified, the default mail host is used.

password.description: Can include a password. Must be specified if username is specified.

port.description: Port number on the protocol-specific send host.

username.description: Can include a user name. Must be specified if password is specified.

receive.description: Property values for the receive mail host.

host.description: Name of the receive mail host machine. If this is not specified, the default mail host is used.

password.description: Can include a password. Must be specified if username is specified.

port.description: Port number on the protocol-specific receive host.

username.description: Can include a user name. Must be specified if password is specified.

items.description: One or more String name and value pairs of other Java mail properties that are not in the on-premises domain. Do not include host, port, credentials, and protocol properties for connecting to the mail server.

jmsModule.description:
Groups information about one or more JMS modules as configured in the source domain.

Each JMS module can have zero or more foreign JMS servers, and zero or more remote Store-and-Forward (SAF) contexts.

jmsmodule.description: Replace this with the actual resourceRef name of a JMSModuleBinding in jmsBindings, as found in the exported JSON file. Specify one object for each JMS module binding found in the exported JSON file. Each object can have zero or more jmsForeignServer, and zero or more safRemoteContext.

jmsForeignServer.description:
Groups information about one or more JMS foreign servers.

Each JMS foreign server must have a JNDI connection URL or destination information for an existing Oracle Java Cloud Service instance.

jmsforeignserver.description: Replace this with the actual resourceRef name of the foreign server binding.

bypassPrecheck.description: Flag that specifies whether to validate the connection to the server during the import operation precheck. Default is false, which means validation is performed and the operation does not continue if the connection is invalid. Set to true if you want to skip the connection validation during the operation precheck.

destination.description:
Information about an existing Oracle Java Cloud Service instance. Provide either server or cluster details for the destination.

Note that either destination or jndiConnectionUrl must be specified for each foreign JMS server object.

jaasInstance.description: Name of the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance to associate with.

cluster.description: Name of cluster in the associated service instance. Either cluster or server must be supplied.

protocol.description: A valid protocol type: t3, t3s, iiop or iiops.

server.description: Name of server in the associated service instance. Either server or cluster must be supplied.

jndiConnectionUrl.description:
JNDI connection URL.

Note that either destination or jndiConnectionUrl must be specified for each foreign JMS server object.

password.description: Can include a password. Must be specified if username is specified.

username.description: Can include a user name. Must be specified if password is specified.

safRemoteContext.description:
Groups information about one or more remote Store-and-Forward (SAF) contexts.

Each remote SAF context must have an URL or destination information for an existing Oracle Java Cloud Service instance.

safremotecontext.description: Replace this with the actual resourceRef name of the remote SAF context binding.

bypassPrecheck.description: Flag that specifies whether to validate the connection to the remote context during the import operation precheck. Default is false, which means validation is performed and the operation does not continue if the connection is invalid. Set to true if you want to skip the connection validation during the operation precheck.

destination.description:
Information about an existing Oracle Java Cloud Service instance. Provide either server or cluster details for the destination.

Note that either destination or url must be specified for each remote SAF context.

jaasInstance.description: Name of the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance to associate with.

cluster.description: Name of cluster in the associated service instance. Either cluster or server must be supplied.

protocol.description: A valid protocol type: t3, t3s, iiop or iiops.

server.description: Name of server in the associated service instance. Either server or cluster must be supplied.

url.description:
The URL that the domain will use to connect to the remote server or cluster.

Note that either destination or url must be specified for each remote SAF context.

password.description: Can include a password. Must be specified if username is specified.

username.description: Can include a user name. Must be specified if password is specified.

jmsMessagingBridge.description:
Groups information about one or more messaging bridges as configured in the source domain.

Each JMS messaging bridge can have a source JMS bridge destination and a target JMS bridge destination.

messagingbridge.description:
Replace this with the actual resourceRef name of a JMSBridgeBinding in jmsBindings, as found in the exported JSON file.

The source and target destination must match the value of the source and target destination in the JMSBridgeBinding. The bridge destinations cannot be changed. If the source or target destination of the binding is empty, this indicates the destination is local to the server or cluster to which the bridge is targeted.

sourceDestination.description: Source JMS bridge destination from which messages are received by the bridge.

targetDestination.description: Target JMS bridge destination to which messages are sent from the bridge.

jmsMessageBridgeDestination.description:
Groups information about one or more message bridge destinations as configured in the source domain.

Each JMS message bridge destination must have a connection URL or destination information for an existing Oracle Java Cloud Service instance.

messagebridgedestination.description: Replace this with the actual resourceRef name of a JMSBridgeDestinationBinding in jmsBindings, as found in the exported JSON file.

bypassPrecheck.description: Flag that specifies whether to validate the connection during the import operation precheck. Default is false, which means validation is performed and the operation does not continue if the connection is invalid. Set to true if you want to skip the connection validation during the operation precheck.

connectionUrl.description:
Connection URL for the JMS bridge destination.

Note that either destination or connectionUrl must be specified for each bridge destination.

destination.description:
Information about an existing Oracle Java Cloud Service instance. Provide either server or cluster details for the destination.

Note that either destination or connectionUrl must be specified for each bridge destination.

jaasInstance.description: Name of the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance to associate with.

cluster.description: Name of cluster in the associated service instance. Either cluster or server must be supplied.

protocol.description: A valid protocol type: t3, t3s, iiop or iiops.

server.description: Name of server in the associated service instance. Either server or cluster must be supplied.

password.description: Can include a password. Must be specified if username is specified.

username.description: Can include a user name. Must be specified if password is specified.

allinstances-allresponse.description: The response body contains information about all Oracle Java Cloud Service instances.

service_type.description: For Oracle Java Cloud Service, the service type is jaas.

services.description: Groups information about the service instances.

allinstances-response.description: The response body contains information about all Oracle Java Cloud Service instances.

auto_update.description: Flag that specifies whether updates to the Oracle Cloud Tools are automatically applied to the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance during the maintenance window. The Oracle Cloud Tools are used to manage the lifecycle of your service instance.

cluster_name.description: Name of the cluster that contains the Managed Servers for the service instance. This attribute is returned when you set the ?outputLevel=verbose query parameter.

compliance_status.description:
Status indicating whether the version of Oracle Cloud Tools is out of compliance. Oracle uses Oracle Cloud Tools to manage the lifecycle of your service instance. If the Oracle Cloud Tools are out of compliance, this attribute is set to one of the following status values:
  • NEW_VERSION: Indicates a new version of Oracle Cloud Tools is available. Oracle strongly recommends that you apply this update as soon as possible.
  • DEPRECATED: Indicates that the current version of Oracle Cloud Tools is deprecated. Apply the latest Oracle Cloud Tools update to avoid any disruption of service in the future.
  • UNSUPPORTED: Indicates that the current version of Oracle Cloud Tools is not supported. Apply the latest patch to resume normal operations.

If the Oracle Cloud Tools are up-to-date, this attribute is blank.

compliance_status_desc.description:
Description that provides more details about the compliance status of the Oracle Cloud Tools, used to manage the lifecycle of your Oracle Java Cloud Service instance. If the service instance is out of compliance, this attribute is set to one of the following descriptions, based on the status value:If the Oracle Cloud Tools are out of compliance, this attribute is set to one of the following status values:
  • NEW_VERSION: A newer version of Oracle tools latestVersion is available. This update includes critical fixes to Oracle Cloud Tools. Oracle uses cloud tools to manage lifecycle of your service. Oracle strongly recommends that customers apply this update as soon as possible.
  • DEPRECATED: This service is currently in a deprecated state because the Oracle tools version deprecatedVersion is deprecated. Apply the latest Oracle tools update as this version may not be supported in the future.
  • UNSUPPORTED: This service is currently in an unsupported state because the Oracle tools version unsupportedVersion is obsolete. Apply the latest patch to resume normal operations.

If the Oracle Cloud Tools are up-to-date, this attribute is blank.

compute_site_name.description: Location where the service instance is provisioned. This attribute is returned when you set the ?outputLevel=verbose query parameter.

content_url.description: Resource URL for accessing the deployed applications using HTTP. This attribute is returned when you set the ?outputLevel=verbose query parameter.

created_by.description: Name of the user account used to create the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance.

creation_job_id.description: Job ID for the create job. This attribute is returned when you set the ?outputLevel=verbose query parameter.

creation_time.description: Date and time the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance was created.

db_associations.description: Groups details of Database Cloud Service database deployments and databases used. This attribute is returned when you set the ?outputLevel=verbose query parameter.

db_info.description:
Database that is used to host the Oracle Required Schema. This attribute is returned when you set the ?outputLevel=verbose query parameter.

On Oracle Public Cloud, this contains information about the Database Cloud Service database deployment.

On Oracle Cloud Machine, this is the database connect string.

db_service_name.description:
This attribute is only available on Oracle Public Cloud. This attribute is returned when you set the ?outputLevel=verbose query parameter.

Name of the Database Cloud Service database deployment that is used to host the Oracle Required Schema.

db_service_uri.description: Resource URL for the Oracle Database Cloud Service database deployment for this service instance. This attribute is returned when you set the ?outputLevel=verbose query parameter.

deletion_job_id.description: Job ID for the delete job. This attribute is returned when you set the ?outputLevel=verbose query parameter.

description.description: Free-form text that provides additional information about the service instance.

domain_mode.description: Mode of the domain. Valid values include: DEVELOPMENT and PRODUCTION. This attribute is returned when you set the ?outputLevel=verbose query parameter.

domain_name.description: Name of the WebLogic domain. This attribute is returned when you set the ?outputLevel=verbose query parameter.

edition.description: Software edition. Valid values include: SE, EE, or SUITE. This attribute is returned when you set the ?outputLevel=verbose query parameter.

error_status_desc.description:
Error status that describes the reason that the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance is in an erroneous state. The following provides an example of the description:

This service is currently in an erroneous state as the tools are in an inconsistent state. Reason - error details. Apply the latest tools patch to resume normal operations on this service.

fmw_control_url.description: URL to Enterprise Manager Fusion Middleware Control. This attribute is returned when you set the ?outputLevel=verbose query parameter.

identity_domain.description:
Identity domain ID for the Oracle Java Cloud Service account (on Oracle Public Cloud).

Tenant name for the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance (on Oracle Cloud Machine).

isApp2Cloud.description:
This attribute is only available on Oracle Public Cloud. It is returned when you set the ?outputLevel=verbose query parameter.

Flag that specifies whether this service instance is created with AppToCloud artifacts. This attribute is displayed only if the service instance was created with AppToCloud artifacts.

last_modified_time.description: Date and time the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance was last modified.

level.description:
Service level. Valid values include:
  • PAAS: Production-level service. Supports Oracle Java Cloud Service instance creation and monitoring; backup and restoration; patching; and scaling. This is the default.
  • BASIC: Developer-level service. Supports Oracle Java Cloud Service instance creation and monitoring.

    Note: This service level does not support backup and restoration, patching, or scaling.

This attribute is returned when you set the ?outputLevel=verbose query parameter.

lifecycle_control_job_id.description:
Job ID of a lifecycle control request. Is a Long value. This attribute appears only if a lifecycle control request is in progress. You can use this ID to check the status of the lifecycle control request (for example, a start/stop/restart operation), as described in View the Status of a Service Instance Lifecycle Operation.

This attribute is returned when you set the ?outputLevel=verbose query parameter.

num_ip_reservations.description: Total number of public IP addresses reserved for the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance. This attribute is returned when you set the ?outputLevel=verbose query parameter.

num_nodes.description: Number of Managed Servers in the domain. This attribute is returned when you set the ?outputLevel=verbose query parameter.

options.description: Groups information about the Coherence data tier.

otd_admin_url.description: URL for accessing the load balancer Administration Console. This attribute is returned when you set the ?outputLevel=verbose query parameter.

otd_provisioned.description: Flag that specifies whether the load balancer is enabled. This attribute is returned when you set the ?outputLevel=verbose query parameter.

otd_shape.description: Desired compute shape for the load balancer. This attribute is returned when you set the ?outputLevel=verbose query parameter.

otd_storage_size.description: Storage size of the load balancer in GBs. This attribute is returned when you set the ?outputLevel=verbose query parameter.

psm_plugin_version.description: Version of the PaaS Service Manager. This attribute is returned when you set the ?outputLevel=verbose query parameter.

sample_app_url.description:
URL for accessing the sample application, if it was deployed and started when the service instance was provisioned. On Oracle Public Cloud, see About the Sample Application Deployed to an Oracle Java Cloud Service Instance in Using Oracle Java Cloud Service. On Oracle Cloud Machine, see About the Sample Application Deployed to an Oracle Java Cloud Service Instance in Using Oracle Java Cloud Service on OPCM.

This attribute is returned when you set the ?outputLevel=verbose query parameter.

secure_content_url.description: URL for accessing the deployed applications using HTTPS. This attribute is returned when you set the ?outputLevel=verbose query parameter.

service_components.description: Groups service component details. This attribute is returned when you set the ?outputLevel=verbose query parameter.

service_name.description: Name of Oracle Java Cloud Service instance.

service_uri.description: Resource URL for the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance.

shape.description:
Desired compute shape.

This attribute is returned when you set the ?outputLevel=verbose query parameter.

shiftJobId.description:
This attribute is only available on Oracle Public Cloud.

Job ID of the customPayload import operation with regards to AppToCloud migration.

This attribute is displayed only if the service instance was created with AppToCloud artifacts, and is returned when you set the ?outputLevel=verbose query parameter.

shiftStatus.description:
This attribute is only available on Oracle Public Cloud.

Status of the service instance with regards to AppToCloud migration. Possible values: readyToShift, shiftCompleted, shiftFailed.

This attribute is displayed only if the service instance was created with AppToCloud artifacts, and is returned when you set the ?outputLevel=verbose query parameter.

status.description: Flag that specifies the status of the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance. Valid values include: Running, In Progress, Maintenance, Stopped, Terminating, and Failed.

subscription_type.description:
Billing frequency.

This attribute is returned when you set the ?outputLevel=verbose query parameter.

On Oracle Public Cloud, the valid values include:

  • HOURLY: Pay only for the number of hours used during your billing period.
  • MONTHLY: Pay one price for the full month irrespective of the number of hours used.

On Oracle Cloud Machine, the attribute is not applicable at this time.

upper_stack_product_name.description:
This attribute is only available on Oracle Public Cloud. It is displayed only if the service instance was created with upperStackProductName, and is returned when you set the ?outputLevel=verbose query parameter.

The Oracle Fusion Middleware product installer added to this service instance. For example: WCP

version.description: Oracle Fusion Middleware software version installed on the service instance. Valid values include: 12cRelease21212cRelease2, 12cR3 and 11g.

wls_admin_url.description: URL to the WebLogic Administration Console. This attribute is returned when you set the ?outputLevel=verbose query parameter.

wls_deployment_channel_port.description: Port for accessing the Administration Server using WLST. This attribute is returned when you set the ?outputLevel=verbose query parameter.

wlsVersion.description: Oracle WebLogic Server software version. For example: 12.2.1.2.0, 12.2.1.0.x, 12.1.3.0.x and 10.3.6.0.x.

This attribute is displayed only if the service instance was created with AppToCloud artifacts.

  • HOURLY: Pay only for the number of hours used during your billing period.

db_apex_url.description: The URL to use to connect to Oracle Application Express on the service instance.

db_app.description: Flag that specifies whether this database is used to host application schemas (true).

db_connect_string.description:
On Oracle Public Cloud, this contains information about the Database Cloud Service database deployment.

On Oracle Cloud Machine, this is the database connection string.

db_em_url.description: The URL to use to connect to Enterprise Manager on the service instance.

db_infra.description: Flag that specifies whether this database is used to host the Oracle Required Schema (true).

db_monitor_url.description: The URL to use to connect to Oracle DBaaS Monitor on the service instance.

db_service_level.description:
Service level for the Database Cloud Service database deployment.

On Oracle Cloud Machine, the only value is PAAS.

db_service_name.description: Name of the Database Cloud Service database deployment.

pdb_service_name.description: Name of the pluggable database created for Oracle Database 12c. This value does not apply to a Database Cloud Service database deployment that is running Oracle Database 11g.

type.description: Service component type. Valid values are JDK, OTD, OTD_JDK, or WLS.

version.description: Software version of the specified component. For example, 12.1.3.0.5 for WLS, 11.1.1.9.1 for OTD, 1.7.0_91 for OTD_JDK, or 1.7.0_91 for JDK.

options.description:
When viewing a service instance, this attribute is returned when the service instance has Oracle Coherence enabled.

When viewing all service instances, this attribute is returned when you set the ?outputLevel=verbose query parameter.

type.description: Specifies the Coherence data tier cluster. This value is set to datagrid.

clusters.description: Groups the information about the datagrid cluster.

When viewing a service instance, this attribute is returned when the service instance has Oracle Coherence enabled.

When viewing all service instances, this attribute is returned when you set the ?outputLevel=verbose query parameter.

clusterName.description: Name of a Coherence data tier cluster for a service instance.

heapIncrements.description: Additional heap available when a capacity unit is added as a result of a scale out operation.

heapSize.description: Heap size to configure per JVM in a capacity unit.

jvmCount.description: Number of JVMs or Managed Servers to configure per VM in a capacity unit.

maxHeap.description: Maximum JVM heap available, based on the site.

maxPrimary.description: Maximum primary cache that can be provided, based on the site.

maxScalingUnit.description: Maximum number of capacity units that can be provisioned, based on the site.

primaryIncrements.description: Primary cache storage that can be added when a capacity unit is added as a result of a scale out operation.

scalingUnitInstances.description: Groups information about the capacity units provisioned in the service instance.

scalingUnitCount.description: Number of capacity units provisioned for the service instance.

scalingUnitName.description: Name of a default capacity unit, if used for the service instance.

shape.description: Shape of the virtual machines provisioned by a capacity unit.

totalHeap.description: Total heap available, based on the number of JVMs configured per capacity unit.

totalPrimary.description: Total primary cache storage to allocate for Coherence, based on the general rule of splitting the JVM heap size into thirds, using 1/3 for primary cache storage, 1/3 for backup storage, and 1/3 for scratch space.

vmCount.description: Number of virtual machines configured per capacity unit.

scalingUnitInstanceId.description: Unique ID for managing a capacity unit.

servers.description: Groups information about the Managed Servers provisioned by a capacity unit.

status.description:
Status of the capacity unit. Valid values are:
  • Ready: Fully operational
  • Starting: Being created or initialized
  • Stopping: Being removed
  • Error: Has some error condition(s)

name.description: Name of a Managed Server on the Coherence data tier.

force.description: Flag used to force the lifecycle state request. This flag is required when you specify the name of a Managed Server and there is more than one Managed Server running on the same VM.

lbAdminHostName.description:
Host name of the load balancer that you want to stop, start, or restart.

Note: This value is not supported for a load balancer that is running on Oracle Fusion Middleware 11g.

lifecycleState.description:
Type of lifecycle state request. Valid values include:
  • stop: Stops the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance, Managed Server, or load balancer, and the associated VM.
  • start: Starts the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance, Managed Server, or load balancer, and the associated VM.
  • restart: Restarts the Administration Server, Managed Server, or load balancer, and the associated VM. For restart, you must specify serverName or lbAdminHostName to identify the Administration Server, Managed Server, or load balancer to restart.

    Only server-level restart is supported in this release. You cannot use restart to restart the service instance. To restart the service instance, issue a stop lifecycle state request followed by a start lifecycle state request.

If the service instance is stopped, you cannot stop, start, or restart the Administration Server, Managed Servers, or load balancer.

lifecycleTimeout.description: Timeout (minutes) for each request. The range of valid values are 1 to 300 minutes (inclusive). The default value is 60 minutes.

serverName.description:
Name of the Managed Server that you want to stop, start, or restart. The lifecycle state request is performed on the VM on which the Managed Server is running. Therefore, If more than one Managed Server is running on the VM, you must set force to true in order for the lifecycle state request to be initiated. If you specify the name of the Administration Server or a Managed Server that runs on the same VM as the Administration Server, then the lifecycleState value can only be set to restart and the force flag much be set to true.

Note: This value is not supported for:

  • Managed Servers that are running on Oracle Fusion Middleware 11g.
  • Managed Servers in the Coherence data tier.

dbaName.description: User name for the database administrator.

dbaPassword.description:
On Oracle Public Cloud, this is the database administrator password that was specified when the Database Cloud Service database deployment was created.

On Oracle Cloud Machine, this is the password for the database administrator.

forceDelete.description: Flag that specifies whether you want to force the removal of the service instance even if the database instance cannot be reached to delete the database schemas. If set to true, you may need to delete the associated database schemas manually on the database instance if they are not deleted as part of the service instance delete operation. The default value is false.

skipBackupOnTerminate.description: Flag that specifies whether you want to back up the service instance or skip backing up the instance before deleting it. The default value is true (that is, skip backing up).

delete-response.description: The response body contains information about the delete operation.

auto_update.description: Flag that specifies whether updates to the Oracle Cloud Tools are automatically applied to the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance during the maintenance window. The Oracle Cloud Tools are used to manage the lifecycle of your service instance.

compliance_status.description:
Status indicating whether the version of Oracle Cloud Tools is out of compliance. Oracle uses Oracle Cloud Tools to manage the lifecycle of your service instance. If the Oracle Cloud Tools are out of compliance, this attribute is set to one of the following status values:
  • NEW_VERSION: Indicates a new version of Oracle Cloud Tools is available. Oracle strongly recommends that you apply this update as soon as possible.
  • DEPRECATED: Indicates that the current version of Oracle Cloud Tools is deprecated. Apply the latest Oracle Cloud Tools update to avoid any disruption of service in the future.
  • UNSUPPORTED: Indicates that the current version of Oracle Cloud Tools is not supported. Apply the latest patch to resume normal operations.

If the Oracle Cloud Tools are up-to-date, this attribute is blank.

compliance_status_desc.description:
Description that provides more details about the compliance status of the Oracle Cloud Tools, used to manage the lifecycle of your Oracle Java Cloud Service instance. If the service instance is out of compliance, this attribute is set to one of the following descriptions, based on the status value:If the Oracle Cloud Tools are out of compliance, this attribute is set to one of the following status values:
  • NEW_VERSION: A newer version of Oracle tools latestVersion is available. This update includes critical fixes to Oracle Cloud Tools. Oracle uses cloud tools to manage lifecycle of your service. Oracle strongly recommends that customers apply this update as soon as possible.
  • DEPRECATED: This service is currently in a deprecated state because the Oracle tools version deprecatedVersion is deprecated. Apply the latest Oracle tools update as this version may not be supported in the future.
  • UNSUPPORTED: This service is currently in an unsupported state because the Oracle tools version unsupportedVersion is obsolete. Apply the latest patch to resume normal operations.

If the Oracle Cloud Tools are up-to-date, this attribute is blank.

created_by.description: Name of the account used to create the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance.

creation_time.description: Date and time the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance was created.

description.description: Free-form text that provides additional information about the service instance.

error_status_desc.description:
Error status that describes the reason that the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance is in an erroneous state. The following provides an example of the description:

This service is currently in an erroneous state as the tools are in an inconsistent state. Reason - error details. Apply the latest tools patch to resume normal operations on this service.

identity_domain.description:
Identity domain ID for the Oracle Java Cloud Service account (on Oracle Public Cloud).

Tenant name for the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance (on Oracle Cloud Machine).

last_modified_time.description: Date and time the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance was last modified.

service_name.description: Name of Oracle Java Cloud Service instance.

service_uri.description: Resource URL of the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance.

status.description: Flag that specifies the status of the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance at the time the delete operation was requested. Valid values include: Running, In Progress, Terminating, and Failed.

version.description: Oracle Fusion Middleware software version. Valid values include: 12cRelease212, 12cRelease2, 12cR3 and 11g.

wlsVersion.description: Oracle WebLogic Server software version. For example: 12.2.1.2.0, 12.2.1.0.x, 12.1.3.0.x and 10.3.6.0.x.

lifecyclestatus-response.description: The response body contains information about the service instance and the status of the operation.

identity_domain.description:
Identity domain ID for the Oracle Java Cloud Service account (on Oracle Public Cloud).

Tenant name for the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance (on Oracle Cloud Machine).

message.description: Contains system messages returned during the service instance lifecycle operation.

last_modified_time.description: Date and time the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance was last modified.

service_name.description: Name of Oracle Java Cloud Service instance.

service_uri.description: Resource URL for the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance.

status.description: Flag that specifies the status of the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance. Valid values include: Running, In Progress, Maintenance, Stopped, Terminating, and Failed.

version.description: Oracle Fusion Middleware software version. For example: 12cRelease212, 12cRelease2, 12cR3 and 11g.

wlsVersion.description: Oracle WebLogic Server software version. For example: 12.2.1.2.0, 12.2.1.0.x, 12.1.3.0.x and 10.3.6.0.x.

secrules-response.description: The response body contains information about the access rules.

activities.description: Groups details about ongoing and failed activity messages, if available.

destination.description: Destination network. Specify the service component to allow traffic to. For example, WLS_ADMIN_SERVER for the virtual machine where the WebLogic Administration Server is running, or OTD for the virtual machine that contains the Oracle Traffic Director administration server.

ports.description: Network port. Specify a single port or a port range. For example, 8989 or 7000-8000.

protocol.description: Communication protocol. Valid values are: tcp or udp. Default is tcp.

source.description:
Network address of source. Specify the hosts from which traffic is allowed. Valid values include:
  • PUBLIC-INTERNET for any host on the Internet
  • A single IP address or a comma-separated list of subnets (in CIDR format) or IPv4 addresses
  • A service component name. Valid values include WLS_ADMIN_SERVER, WLS_MANAGED_SERVER, OTD, DB

status.description: Status of the rule. Specify whether the status should be enabled or disabled. Valid value: disabled or enabled.

destination.description: The service component to allow traffic to. For example, WLS_ADMIN_SERVER or OTD.

ruleType.description: Type of rule. For example, SYSTEM, DEFAULT, or USER.

ports.description: Ports for the rule. This can be a single port or a port range.

source.description: The hosts from which traffic is allowed. For example, PUBLIC-INTERNET for any host on the Internet, a single IP address or a comma-separated list of subnets (in CIDR format) or IPv4 addresses, or a service component name such as WLS_ADMIN_SERVER, WLS_MANAGED_SERVER, OTD, or DB.

status.description: Status of the rule. Valid value: disabled or enabled.

activity.description: Groups messages and errors for ongoing and failed activities.

errors.description: Error encountered for an ongoing or failed activity.

message.description: Message of an ongoing or failed activity.

operation.description: Type of operation to perform on the access rule. Valid values are: update (to disable or enable a rule) and delete (to delete a rule).

status.description: State of the access rule to update to. This attribute is required only when you disable or enable a rule. Valid value is disable or enable.

destination.description: The service component to allow traffic to.

rule.description: Groups information about rules. This attribute is returned when you delete a rule.

source.description: The hosts from which traffic is allowed.

status.description: Status of the rule.

backupconfig-response.description: The response body includes information about the backup configuration. If specific changes in the backup configuration are requested and successfully completed, the response body shows the updated configuration. Otherwise, the response body shows the existing backup configuration for the service instance.

backupDestination.description:
Location of the backups (for PAAS service level instances only).

Note the difference between Oracle Public Cloud and Oracle Cloud Machine.

On Oracle Public Cloud, this configurable value defaults to BOTH (which means Disk and Oracle Storage Cloud Service Container).

On Oracle Cloud Machine, this non-configurable value defaults to Disk and NFS remote storage.

cloudStorageContainer.description:
Where service instance backups are stored.

On Oracle Public Cloud, this is the URI of the Oracle Storage Cloud Service container.

On Oracle Cloud Machine, this is the NFS URI of the remote storage.

cloudStorageUser.description: User name to access the specified Oracle Storage Cloud Service container. This attribute is only available on Oracle Public Cloud.

defaultRetention.description:
Number of days incremental backups and full on-demand backups are retained. If set to null, backups are retained indefinitely or until you manually delete them.

Full scheduled backups are retained until their last related incremental backup is no longer available, if any.

extendedRestoreTypes.description: Only value is NONE. This means that restoration of backups is supported only by using a backup ID.

fullBackupSchedule.description: Schedule for the next full backup.

incrementalBackupSchedule.description: Schedule for the next incremental backup.

lastBackupDate.description:
Date and time that the last backup completed.

Note: If there have been no backups, this attribute is omitted.

lastSuccessfulCleanupDate.description: Date and time that the last successful cleanup job completed. The cleanup job is run after the scheduled backup for the day is completed. The cleanup job purges old records, deletes expired backups or removes expired local copies (that are due to be deleted or removed that day).

nextFullBackupDate.description:
Scheduled date and time for next full backup.

On Oracle Public Cloud, this attribute is not available when the state of the backup service is disabled for the service instance.

nextIncrementalBackupDate.description:
Scheduled date and time for next incremental backup.

On Oracle Public Cloud, this attribute is not available when the state of the backup service is disabled for the service instance.

percentBackupVolumeUsed.description: Total percent of the backup volume that is currently in use.

scheduledBackups.description: Type of scheduled backups. Only value is ALL. This means both full and incremental scheduled backups are enabled.

state.description: State of the backup service for the service instance. For example, ENABLED or DISABLED.

totalBackupVolumeUsed.description: Total amount (in GBs) of the backup volume that is currently in use.

totalBackupVolumeUsedInBytes.description: Total amount (in Bytes) of the backup volume that is currently in use.

totalCloudStorageContainerUsed.description:
On Oracle Public Cloud, the total amount (in GBs) of the Storage Cloud Service container space that is currently in use.

On Oracle Cloud Machine, the total amount (in GBs) of the NFS remote storage disk that is currently in use.

totalCloudStorageContainerUsedInBytes.description:
On Oracle Public Cloud, the total amount (in Bytes) of the Storage Cloud Service container space that is currently in use.

On Oracle Cloud Machine, the total amount (in Bytes) of the NFS remote storage disk that is currently in use.

second.description: Seconds. This value is not configurable. It defaults to 0.

dayOfMonth.description: Day of the month. This value is not configurable. It defaults to all days of the month (*).

month.description: Month. This value is not configurable. It defaults to all months (*).

dayOfWeek.description: Day of the week. Valid values are: Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sat, Sun. For full backups, only one value (day) is allowed. For incremental backups, one or more values (days) are allowed. If a value is not specified for incremental backups, the default value is calculated as all days except the day that full backups are initiated.

year.description: Year. This value is not configurable. It defaults to all years (*).

backupconfig-postrequest.description: The request body defines the details of the backup configuration update request. There are no required attributes, but you must specify the backups parameter to disable or reenable the backup service for the specified service instance.

backups.description:
State of the backup service you want to set for the specified Oracle Java Cloud Service instance. Valid value: DISABLE, ENABLE, or UNCHANGED (default).

When the backup service is disabled, both on-demand and scheduled automated backups are disabled. The following operations are also not permitted on the service instance when the backup service is disabled:

  • Update the backup configuration
  • Restore from an existing backup
  • Apply a patch
  • Rollback a patch

cloudStorageContainer.description:
Where to store service instance backups.

On Oracle Public Cloud, this is the URI of an existing Oracle Storage Cloud Service container. Use the format storageservicename-storageidentitydomain/containername

If you change the storage container, any existing backups in the previous storage container will remain there and be available for service restoration until the retention period has elapsed.

If you try to change the storage container and the storage user credentials (cloudStorageUser and cloudStoragePwd), the storage container will not be updated to the new URI if at least one existing backup in the old container cannot be used because the old container cannot be accessed with the new credentials.

On Oracle Cloud Machine, this is the NFS URI of the remote storage. Use the format ip-address:export-path

This value cannot be changed if the NFS remote storage disk contains backup archives for the service instance.

cloudStorageUser.description: Oracle Storage Cloud Service user name used to access the specified container. This attribute is only available on Oracle Public Cloud.

cloudStoragePwd.description: Password of the user name to access the specified container. This attribute is only available on Oracle Public Cloud.

defaultRetention.description:
Number of days incremental backups and full on-demand backups are retained. This value defaults to 30. Full scheduled backups are retained until their last related incremental backup is no longer available, if any.

Any change to the default retention value will affect new backups as well as existing backups. This means if you change the value to smaller number, existing backups that meet the updated retention policy will be deleted at the next scheduled maintenance cycle.

Set the default retention value to null to retain backups indefinitely or until you manually delete them.

fullBackupSchedule.description:
Schedule for the next full backup.

By default, full backups are initiated weekly starting 12 hours after an instance was created, rounded to the nearest five-minute interval.

Note: Though not recommended, you can disable full backups temporarily by setting this attribute to null.

incrementalBackupSchedule.description:
Schedule for the next incremental backup.

By default, incremental backups are initiated every day except the day that full backups are initiated.

Note: Though not recommended, you can disable incremental backups temporarily by setting this attribute to null.

ondemand-request.description: The request body contains information about the on-demand backup operation. There are no required attributes.

databaseIncluded.description:
Flag that specifies whether a database backup is included as part of this on-demand backup operation. This attribute is only applicable to Oracle Public Cloud. Only false is supported on Oracle Cloud Machine.

On Oracle Public Cloud, the value defaults to false, indicating that a database backup is not performed. If the value is set to true, a database backup is performed. However, the database files for the associated Database Cloud Service database deployment are not actually included in the backup; only an RMAN tag or a timestamp is included, depending on whether the Database Cloud Service database deployment is hosting a single-instance database or an Oracle Real Application Clusters (RAC) database.

Note: If the associated Database Cloud Service database deployment is hosting a RAC database and a database backup is included, the on-demand backup expiration date cannot be null.

expirationDate.description: Deprecated. To set a null expiration date for full backups, use keepForever set to true.

full.description:
Flag that specifies the type of on-demand backup. Only true is a valid option, false is not supported. Full backups contain all of the service instance configuration data.

On Oracle Public Cloud, from the December 2015 update and onwards, only true is supported; in previous releases you were allowed to specify whether to start a full or incremental on-demand backup.

keepForever.description:
Flag that specifies whether to keep the backup indefinitely. Set this value to true to keep the backup indefinitely or until it is deleted manually. (This is the same behavior as expirationDate set to null.) Set this value to false to delete the backup at the end of the default retention period for the service instance's backups. (Backups are retained for the default retention period as defined in the service instance's backup configuration; see View the Backup Configuration.)

Note: On Oracle Public Cloud, if the associated Oracle Database Cloud Service database deployment is hosting an Oracle Real Application Clusters (RAC) database, a database backup cannot be performed as part of the on-demand backup operation when the keepForever value is set to true.

notes.description: Free-form text to provide additional information about the backup.

ondemand-response.description: The response body contains information about the on-demand backup operation.

job_id.description: Job ID for the backup operation.

viewallbackups-response.description: The response body contains information about all backups.

backupInProgress.description: Groups details of a backup currently in progress, if any.

backupId.description: Backup ID. You can use the backup ID to manage the specific backup (for example, download or archive).

backupStartDate.description: Date and time that the backup started.

backupCompleteDate.description: Date and time that the backup completed. This attribute is not valid for backups that are in progress.

databaseIncluded.description:
Flag that specifies whether a database backup was performed as part of the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance backup operation. This attribute is only applicable to Oracle Public Cloud. If false, a database backup was not performed. If true, a database backup was performed.

On Oracle Cloud Machine, the value is always false.

dbTag.description:
An RMAN tag or a timestamp. This attribute is only applicable to Oracle Public Cloud.

The attribute is included only if a database backup was performed as part of the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance backup. When the associated Database Cloud Service database deployment is hosting a single-instance database, the attribute value is the RMAN tag that identifies the specific database files backed up. When the associated Database Cloud Service database deployment is hosting an Oracle Real Application Clusters (RAC) database, the attribute value is the timestamp of the database backup. In either case, you use the attribute value to restore the database, if necessary. For information about restoring the database files, see Restoring from a Specific Backup or Restoring to a Specific Point in Time in Using Oracle Database Cloud Service.

deletedOnDate.description: Date and time that the backup deletion completed. This attribute is not valid for backups that are in progress or still available.

expirationDate.description: Date and time that the backup will be deleted automatically from storage. If the value is null, the backup is retained indefinitely or until you manually delete it. (Value is null when keepForever was set to true for an on-demand backup.)

full.description: Flag that specifies whether this is a full (true) or incremental (false) backup. A full backup contains all the runtime artifacts required to restore the service instance configuration data. An incremental backup contains changes to configuration data on all virtual machines since the last scheduled full backup.

initiatedBy.description: User account that initiated this operation. If the operation is a scheduled automated backup, the value is scheduled.

jobId.description: Job ID for the backup.

local.description:
Flag that specifies whether the backup is to be downloaded and stored locally in block storage on the Administration Server (true), or archived and stored remotely (false).

On Oracle Public Cloud, the remote storage is the specified Oracle Storage Cloud Service container.

On Oracle Cloud Machine, the remote storage is the specified NFS storage disk.

localCopy.description:
Flag that specifies whether the local copy of a backup is maintained for a backup that has been uploaded to remote storage.

On Oracle Public Cloud, the remote storage is the specified Oracle Storage Cloud Service container.

On Oracle Cloud Machine, the remote storage is the specified NFS storage disk.

notes.description: Free-form text that provides additional information about the backup.

size.description: Size of the backup, in MBs. For example: 1011.4MB (backup complete) or Unknown (backup in-progress).

sizeInBytes.description: Size of the backup, in Bytes.

status.description: Status of the backup. Valid values include: Completed, Failed, Deleted, Backup In Progress, Upload In Progress, Download In Progress, Restore In Progress, or Delete In Progress.

storageContainer.description:
This atttribute is only available on Oracle Public Cloud.

Where service instance backups are stored.

forceScaleInRequiredForRestore.description:
Message that indicates the current Oracle Java Cloud Service instance has Managed Servers configured that are not included in this backup. This value is set to the following error message that provides more information:

JAAS-BR-105: Unable to restore configuration data for managed servers that are not part of the backup. The affected managedsServers are: [managedserver_x, managedserver_y]. Scale in the instance to remove these managed servers' nodes and then try to restore the instance again.

Before you restore the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance using this backup, perform one of the following steps:

  • Scale in the instance to remove the Managed Servers noted in the error message above.
  • To automatically scale in the Oracle Java Cloud Service instance, set the forceScaleIn attribute to true when restoring using this backup, as described in Restore a Service Instance.

full.description: Flag that specifies whether this is a full (true) or incremental (false) backup. A full backup contains all the runtime artifacts required to restore the service instance configuration data. An incremental backup contains changes to configuration data on all virtual machines since the last scheduled full backup.

fullBackup.description: Related full backup details. This attribute is returned when you set the ?includeLinkedDetails query parameter to true.

backupId.description: Backup ID. You can use the backup ID to manage the specific backup (for example, download or archive).

backupStartDate.description: Date and time that the backup started.

backupCompleteDate.description: Date and time that the backup completed.

completeDate.description: Date and time that the operation completed.

jobId.description: Job ID for the backup.

operation.description: Type of operation that was executed. For example, backup, delete, upload, download, and so on.

startDate.description: Date and time the operation started.

statusDetails.description: History of system messages. Each message is separated by an ellipses {...}.
